co.poynt.os.services.v1

Interface IPoyntSecurityService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.os.IInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPoyntSecurityService.Stub

    public interface IPoyntSecurityService
extends android.os.IInterface
    Provides interfaces to upate working key (for Master Key and Working Key) and encryption using special dukpt key. All calls require the necessary permissions declared in the caller's Android Manifest file. Please refer to Poynt OS Permissions for more details.
    Since:
    1.0-beta4

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPoyntSecurityService.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

      Request to collect card data and other requested fields through card reader (second screen) securely.

    • Method Detail

      • encryptDukpt

        void encryptDukpt(DukptData dataToEncrypt,
                  IPoyntDataEncryptionListener callback)
           throws android.os.RemoteException
        Encrypts the given data using Dukpt key for external data encryption. Returns the encrypted data along with KSN through the callback.
        Parameters:
        data - to encrypt
        callback - IPoyntDataEncryptionListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • updateSessionKey

        void updateSessionKey(int keySlotId,
                      byte[] encryptedSessionKey,
                      byte[] sessionKeyMac,
                      byte[] keyId,
                      IPoyntKeyUpdateListener callback)
               throws android.os.RemoteException
        Update current session (aka working) key with the given new encrypted key. The new session key must be encrypted with the corresponding master key.
        Parameters:
        key - slot if for the master key that corresponds to this session key
        encrypted - session key
        session - key mac
        keyId - an 8-byte identifier for the key for identification purposes
        callback - IPoyntKeyUpdateListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • collectNewPin

        void collectNewPin(IPoyntNewPINListener callback)
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Request to collect a new PIN from the consumer. Returns the encrypted PIN along with KSN through the callback. NOTE that this method only works if a transaction is waiting for an online authorization response.
        Parameters:
        callback - IPoyntDataEncryptionListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • collectManualEntryData

        void collectManualEntryData(java.util.List<ManualEntryInputField> inputFields,
                            java.util.List<ManualEntryOutputField> outputFields,
                            java.util.List<ManualEntryFieldType> electronicReferralContent,
                            java.util.List<ManualEntryFieldType> positiveIdContent,
                            byte[] msrToken,
                            IPoyntManualEntryDataListener callback)
                     throws android.os.RemoteException
        Request to collect card data and other requested fields through card reader (second screen) securely.
        Parameters:
        inputFields -
        outputFields -
        electronicReferralContent - fields to include in the electronic Referral field if requested
        positiveIdContent - fields to include in the positiveId field if requested
        msrToken - to use same DUKPT key used for card data encryption in the previous swipe txn
        manualEntryDataListener - callback
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • updateSessionKeyLegacy

        void updateSessionKeyLegacy(int keySlotId,
                            byte[] encryptedSessionKey,
                            byte[] keyId,
                            IPoyntKeyUpdateListener callback)
                     throws android.os.RemoteException
        Legacy update current session key with the given new encrypted key. The new session key must be encrypted with the corresponding master key.
        Parameters:
        key - slot if for the master key that corresponds to this session key
        encrypted - session key
        keyId - an 8-byte identifier for the key for identification purposes
        callback - IPoyntKeyUpdateListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
